Start: ^I shuffle into the kitchen, which is much more packed than usual, with everybody showing up for the celebatory Welcome Dinner.
^The Halfway Home has these big get together dinners whenever we get someone new, or someone leaves.
^It's supposed to be a big bonding moment. Or, something like that.
^I actually barely remember my welcome dinner. I think there were beans? That's about all I got.
^Timothy, the star of this show, gets the center seat, so he can meet everybody. Currently, he seems to be talking with Trissa.
^Eduardo and Isaac are off in their own little corner, giggling to themselves.
^Charlotte and Max are helping serve food at the front of the line.
NearTimothy: ^I guess I must be a bit late since the line for food isn't all that long. I grab a plate and head for the center table.
^I pull up a chair next to Timothy and take a seat. Trissa gives me a welcoming smile.
^[Trissa] "Come to see the man of hour, huh?"

b: ^[Voices] "As if he wants to see you."

NearTimothy: ^[Trissa] "Like I was saying. You've got nothing to worry about! Everybody here is excited to meet you!"

b: ^] "You're a nice guy, Timothy. Just be yourself and if anybody has a problem with that their opinion shouldn't matter to you."
^] "I remember feeling the same way at my welcome dinner. It's okay be to nervous. It'll pass soon."

c: ^[Trissa] "I get it. Meeting new people can be hard, but we're all nice!"
^[Trissa] "If you can handle [i]my[/i] energy, you can handle anything!"

g-0: ^Timothy looks grateful. He is about to reply when Max shows up with a plate of food.
^I give them a nod of acknowledgement.
^[Max] "I can't wait to talk about your first day, Timothy, but first we've gotta deal with the formalities. One sec."
^Max stands up and clears his throat.

NearEduardo: ^I guess I must be a bit late since the line for food isn't all that long. I grab a plate and head for Eduardo and Isaac's booth.
^As I approach, the two are giggling about something.

b: ^[Voices] "Of course they mind. Why would anyone want [i]you[/i] around?"

NearEduardo: ^Isaac is too busy cracking up to respond, but Eduardo is able to compose himself. Briefly.
^[Eduardo] "I was just telling my meu bem Isaac here the story about [i]my[/i] first day. I could have sworn I already told it to him, though."
^[Isaac] "Oh, you have. I just never get tired of it."
^[Eduardo] "You sneaky devil, you. Taking advantage of my poor memory, will you? TWO can play at that game, tesouro."
^, you ever heard the story of Isaac's first day?"
^[Eduardo] "It was only a couple of weeks before yours..."
^As if on cue, Max makes a loud sound from the center of the room and rises to their feet.
NearCharlotte: ^I duck past the line to where Charlotte stands behind the serving area, busily refilling several trays at once.
^] "Hey, Charlotte. Is there uh... something I can help with maybe?"
^[Charlotte] "I'm sure I could find a use for you."

b: ^[Voices] "She'd have to be a miracle worker to do [i]that[/i]."

NearCharlotte: ^[Charlotte] "Heavens, that was curt of me. Allow me to try that again."
^[Charlotte] "That is very generous of you. I can't think of anything at the moment, but..."
^[Charlotte] "On second thought, there actually is a task for which I could benefit from your assistance. Or, more accurately, Max could."
^[Max] "Say what now? Did I hear my name?"
^[Charlotte] "It is my understanding that you're about to make the preparations for Timothy's toast. Is that correct?"
^ make for a suitable second to perform your duties while you are thusly occupied?"
^ could totally cover for me. I'd actually really appreciate that!"
^Max hustles toward the kitchen and out of sight.
^I spend the next few minutes dishing up food and replacing trays. It's nice to see how happy people look to get a good meal.
^Max returns with a plate of their own.
^[Max] "Everything's set. Hit me up with some grub,
^! Oh, and you're good to eat with us as soon as I've done the toast."
^The moment I finish dishing them up a sizeable portion, Max takes off towards the center table.
Toast: ^The whole cafe quites a little, as Max speaks up.
^[Max] "Today we're welcoming our newest family member, Timothy Myuri."
^[Max] "Now, Some of you have already talked with him, but for those, that haven't, he's dis guy right here."
^[Max] "He just got out Blackwell Hospital, for those who need the context for that,"
^[Max] "And he said he's not really up to this kinda group speaking, which we all can understand."
^[Max] "But we all want to wish him the best of luck"
^[Max] "And to welcome him to our home."
^Max sits back down near Timothy, and the usual chatter of the room resumes.

b: ^I get up and move closer to them and Timothy, given Trissa seems to have up and moved.

TutorialTalk: ^[Max] "I wanna thank ya for showing Timothy the ropes for me."
^[Max] "The little sucker fell between the couch cushions in the commons. Must've been loose on my chain or somethin'."
GeneralTalk: ^[Max] "I wanna again, apologies for the whole roommate debacle."
^[Max] "I know you don't want another thing on your plate for this week."
^[Max] "Also, thanks with the save with the keys."
^[Max] "how'd you even know they were there?"
^[Max]"Well that's some fine luck ya got."
TalkingToTimothy: ^[Timothy] "It's nice. Uh, sorry again for taking the other bed. I'm sure you were enjoying the extra space."

b: ^] "Actually, I think it'll be good for me to have some company during my last week."
^] "Oh, please. I feel worse for you. You've gotta share a room with [i]me[/i]."

TalkingToTimothy: ^We spend the next hour or so talking about our interests and such.
^It's mostly small talk, but Timothy relaxes more the longer we chat.
^When it's finally time to head to bed, he seems almost comfortable.
